document_title: Chronic vaginitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, treatment
subsection_content:
As soon as you have symptoms of vaginal infection, you should immediately go to a medical facility with a reputable Obstetrics department for examination. To find the exact cause of the disease and treat it properly, the doctor will diagnose the disease by: (4)
Examination of medical history: The doctor will ask about the history of gynecological diseases and sexually transmitted diseases, if any. In addition, information about private area hygiene and frequency of sexual intercourse is also explored.; Ask about disease symptoms: The doctor will ask about the symptoms you are experiencing to get more information to diagnose the disease. It is best for women to list fully and in detail the symptoms they experience.; Pelvic examination: The doctor uses a vaginal examination instrument called a speculum, inserted through the vulva to observe the current condition of the vagina such as swelling, discharge and characteristics of the discharge...; Taking a specimen: The doctor will take vaginal secretions to conduct tests to find the cause of the disease.; Check pH: The doctor uses pH test strips or pH paper to check vaginal pH. If the pH level is high, it means the vaginal infection is caused by bacteria or Trichomonas. However, other tests are still needed to increase the accuracy of diagnosis.
